Carcinoid Tumors in the Small Intestine
		                    It is not clear what the best treatment is for GI carcinoid tumors in the duodenum (first part of the small intestine, that connects to the stomach). Treatment may include the following:         -  Endoscopic surgery (resection) for small tumors.    - Surgery (local excision) to remove slightly larger tumors.    - Surgery (resection) to remove the tumor and nearby lymph nodes.
